docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama drew sustained laughter from Congress, especially Democrats, on Wednesday when he declared in his State of the Union speech that "by now it should be fairly obvious that I didn't take on health care because it was good politics."

docs.lead_paragraph: More than half of the low-wage workers in New York City are routinely being cheated of some of the meager pay that is due them, according to a report to be released on Thursday by the National Employment Law Project.

headline.main: Most Low-Wage Workers Are Cheated of Pay, Report Finds

docs.abstract: A study by a labor advocacy group found that the average worker in a low-wage job in New York City loses more than $3,000 per year to employers who pay less than minimum wage, do not pay overtime or violate other labor laws.
docs.snippet: A study by a labor advocacy group found that the average worker in a low-wage job in New York City loses more than $3,000 per year to employers who pay less than minimum wage, do not pay overtime or violate other labor laws.
